title: E field of distribution - segments 1 and 2 at P

content.question: Two straight segments of charged wire are parallel to each other and oriented as shown in the figure. The line segments have different uniform linear charge densities: <math alttext="positive lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>λ</mi></math> for Segment <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="negative lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>λ</mi></math> for Segment <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the magnitude of the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction lambda over 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from negative L over 2 to L over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, uppercase D squared plus x squared, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, 2 uppercase D, close parenthesis, squared, plus x squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, lowercase d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction lambda over 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from negative L over 2 to L over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, uppercase D squared plus x squared, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, 2 uppercase D, close parenthesis, squared, plus x squared, end fraction, close parenthesis, lowercase d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction lambda uppercase D over 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from negative L over 2 to L over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 2 uppercase D, close parenthesis, squared, plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, close parenthesis, lowercase d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction lambda uppercase D over 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from negative L over 2 to L over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 2 uppercase D, close parenthesis, squared, plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, close parenthesis, lowercase d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction lambda uppercase D over 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times the integral from negative L over 2 to L over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 2 uppercase D, close parenthesis, squared, plus x squared, close parenthesis, to the three halves power, end fraction, close parenthesis, lowercase d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>λ</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
